content.question: Two closed, cylindrical containers with fixed volumes have the same diameter, and each container holds a sample of ideal gas with the same number of molecules. The containers are brought into thermal contact, as shown, and then isolated from the surrounding environment. Which of the following best describes the change in temperature of the gas in Container <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> immediately after the two containers are brought into thermal contact, and gives a reason for that change?

choices.label: The temperature of the gas in Container <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> will increase because thermal energy is transferred out of the larger container and into the smaller container <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>.

The temperature of the gas in Container <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> will increase because the faster-moving atoms will make more collisions with the container walls than the atom in Container <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>.

The temperature of the gas in Container <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> will decrease because the pressure is higher in Container <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, and energy will be transferred until the pressures are the same.

The temperature of the gas in Container <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> will decrease because energy is transferred from the gas at higher temperature to the gas at lower temperature.
